key_points: Investigation focuses on Ever Given's black box for insights into Suez Canal blockage.
Initial report on the grounding, which cost Egypt an estimated $1 billion, expected soon.
400+ ships delayed, blocking $400 million per hour in international trade.
Ever Given holding $3 billion worth of goods, stuck pending damage accord.
Egypt seeks peaceful resolution for compensation without litigation.
Black box data crucial for understanding ship's mechanical and navigational state during grounding.
Legal battles anticipated in multiple national courts over the incident.
Compensation for delay without physical damages unlikely.
Suez Canal is a vital global trade route, with over 18,000 ships passing in the previous year.
Legal and insurance complexities emerge, including general average declaration and potential defenses.
spokespersons: Lawrence Brennan (Maritime Law Professor, Fordham Law School)
Eric Hsieh (Company president, Evergreen Marine Corp.)
